metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7940 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The collator implementation in i18n/ucol.cpp in International Components for Unicode (ICU) 52 through SVN revision 293126, as used in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91, does not initialize memory for a data structure, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted character sequence.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7940` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
No subscription required

libicu52 - 52.1-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code in icu has changed, so no equivalent commit in icu tree first google patch is buggy, as prevPos is getting set _after_ the getNextNormalizedChar second google patch is buggy as source->endp is being checked without checking the UCOL_ITER_HASLEN flag

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068').
icu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.1-3ubuntu0.2').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
